posts.name: NewtonCrosby
posts.cooked:
I have an odd thing I can’t figure out with PyTest…or pathplanner, or both.

When I run the tests with an extra summary report, here’s the output

My code is only calling Autobuilder from Pathplanner in one spot, RobotInit.

So it would appear that somehow I’m in a state where the library knows that I’ve configured the builder once, but RobotInit() is being called once for each test run.  I don’t understand how that is happening, or how to fix the tests.

Any advice?

posts.name: Dustin Spicuzza
posts.cooked: My guess is that pathplannerlib has a global somewhere, which is not supported for RobotPy programs.

posts.name: Michael Jansen
posts.cooked: Update to the latest version. This should be fixed

posts.name: NewtonCrosby
posts.cooked:
My Toml file:

Then I run python -m robotpy sync

Still broken.

Tests all pass.

posts.name: NewtonCrosby
posts.cooked: I put my results in here for posterity, in case for some reason they see the same problem with syncing to latest.

posts.name: Michael Jansen
posts.cooked:
NewtonCrosby:

Tests all pass.

Is this the right list? The latest is 2024.1.6

posts.name: NewtonCrosby
posts.cooked:
No, I had to manually update with pip -U to get it to update.

Edit… now I see the copy paste error…will fix above.

posts.name: Michael Jansen
posts.cooked: I’m not 100% sure on this, maybe @virtuald can confirm. But I think since the requirement you have is just robotpy-pathplannerlib , any version will satisfy that. I believe that if you changed it to something like robotpy-pathplannerlib>=2024.1.6 it would get a new version if available (I think as long as its 2024.1.X).

posts.name: viggy96
posts.cooked: Is this also fixed for Java? I was having a similar issue before but I worked around it.

posts.name: Dustin Spicuzza
posts.cooked: Yes, you would need to put a version constraint in pyproject.toml to avoid having to run pip separately.

posts.name: Michael Jansen
posts.cooked: Yes, all languages will just print an error now instead of throwing
